svcproc.title: Camshaft Position (CMP) Sensor
svcproc.para: The CMP sensor is a Hall Effect sensor stacked in front of a magnet with a signal conditioning integrated circuit. The CMP sensor responds to a rotating actuator positioned on the camshaft gear. The camshaft actuator has 24 stamped windows. This produces a rectangular wave pulse for each tooth as the actuator rotates past the CMP sensor. The pulses are used to indicate engine speed and camshaft position for control of fuel quantity, injection timing and overspeed shutdown. The CMP sensor is located above the water pump pulley on the right side of the engine front cover.
